entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Traffic Inspection with AWS Cloud WAN

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Traffic Inspection with AWS Cloud WAN

entry.content:
29 February 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Traffic Inspection with AWS Cloud WAN

Hosts:
Sidhartha Chauhan

Guests:
Pratik Mankad, Senior SA, Networking

Abstract:
AWS Cloud WAN connects your branch offices, data centers, and Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (Amazon VPCs), helping you build a global network with a few clicks. In this chalk talk, explore architecture models for inspecting ingress, egress, and east-west traffic when using AWS Cloud WAN.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 29 February 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting multicloud and hybrid networks

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting multicloud and hybrid networks

entry.content:
22 February 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting multicloud and hybrid networks

Hosts:
Matt Lehwess

Guests:
James Devine, Principal SA
Alexis Marcou, Senior SA

Abstract:
There is additional complexity to consider when connecting your network with other cloud providers, your on-premises network, or resources in a collocation facility. In this chalk talk, learn common patterns for multicloud and hybrid connectivity using AWS Direct Connect, AWS Cloud WAN, AWS Transit Gateway, AWS Site-to-Site VPN, or SD-WAN devices. Based on your questions, the talk will introduce real-world use cases and best practices.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 22 February 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: Public IPv4 Pricing Change Q&A
entry.content:
15 February 2024

Public IPv4 Pricing Change Q&A

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel, Alexandra Huides

Guests:

Abstract:
On Feb 1st, the new charge for public IPv4 addresses announced on 7/28/2023 came in effect. Join us in this session to dive deeper into how you can identify and optimize these costs. We'll also talk about IPv6, of course, and see if and how adopting IPv6 can help you optimize public IPv4 usage.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 15 February 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Networking strategies for Kubernetes on AWS

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Networking strategies for Kubernetes on AWS

entry.content:
8 February 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Networking strategies for Kubernetes on AWS

Hosts:
Alexandra Huides

Guests:
Federica Ciuffo, Senior Containers SA

Abstract:
Deploying Kubernetes clusters requires collaboration between cluster operators, network operators, and security operators. This chalk talk, intended for developers, system admins, and DevOps engineers, explores strategies and considerations for cluster operators as they begin their journey into Kubernetes. Topics include pod networking, service discovery, cluster policies, load balancing, and service meshes. Join us to learn more about Kubernetes networking on AWS.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 8 February 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting and securing services with Amazon VPC Lattice

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting and securing services with Amazon VPC Lattice

entry.content:
1 February 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting and securing services with Amazon VPC Lattice

Hosts:
Riggs Goodman III

Guests:
Justin Davies, Principal Product Manager
Satish Katpally, Principal Networking Specialist
Jamie Wenzel, Principal Solutions Architect ELB

Abstract:
Amazon VPC Lattice helps you connect your applications and services securely and simplifies the way microservices communicate in a multi-account and multi-virtual private cloud (VPC) environment. In this chalk talk, learn how you can connect your Amazon EC2, Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, or AWS Lambda microservices whether they are on AWS or on premises. Explore common use cases like multiple account/VPC connectivity, service-to-service authentication and authorization, load balancing, blue-green/canary deployments, and more. Bring your questions.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 1 February 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Why is it always DNS? Ask us anything

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Why is it always DNS? Ask us anything

entry.content:
25 January 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Why is it always DNS? Ask us anything

Hosts:
Tom Adamski

Guests:
Steve Seymour, WW Tech Leader, Networking
Christian Elsen, Principal Networking SA

Abstract:
This chalk talk helps you better understand how the many capabilities of Amazon Route 53—including Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall and public hosted zones over registrar services and Route 53 Resolver endpoints—fit into the bigger picture of DNS as a foundational networking service. Whether you have been wanting to move your domain to AWS but have been nervous about the widespread impact a mistake could cause or are just curious what benefits DNSSEC might bring you, this session is for you.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 25 January 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

What's new with AWS Verified Access

Alexandra Huides, Tom Adamski

Guests:

Abstract:
Join us for an overview of AWS Verified Access, zero trust access solution for your private applications in AWS and beyond. We'll recap some of the new launches from 2023
